block.p: Kristin Ashley O'Connell, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. O'Connell of Fairfield, Conn., was married yesterday to J. Rexford Hampton, a son of Elizabeth E. Hampton of Arlington, Va., and the late Wade H. Hampton. The Very Rev. John F. McCard performed the ceremony at St. Mark's Episcopal Church on Marco Island, Fla.

Mrs. Hampton, 25, is a telecommunications analyst in the Brussels office of American Management Systems, a consulting company for information technology. Mr. Hampton, who is 28 and known as Rex, is the manager of accounting policy for Marriott International in Bethesda, Md. The couple graduated from the University of Virginia, where in the fall they are to begin studying for M.B.A. degrees.

Kristin Ashley O'Connell, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. O'Connell of Fairfield, Conn., was married yesterday to J. Rexford Hampton, a son of Elizabeth E. Hampton of Arlington, Va., and the late Wade H. Hampton. The Very Rev. John F. McCard performed the ceremony at St. Mark's Episcopal Church on Marco Island, Fla.

Mrs. Hampton, 25, is a telecommunications analyst in the Brussels office of American Management Systems, a consulting company for information technology. Mr. Hampton, who is 28 and known as Rex, is the manager of accounting policy for Marriott International in Bethesda, Md. The couple graduated from the University of Virginia, where in the fall they are to begin studying for M.B.A. degrees.

The bride's father is the chairman and chief executive of the MassMutual Financial Group, a financial services company in Springfield, Mass. Her mother, Claire M. O'Connell, retired as a health-education teacher at Fairfield Woods Middle School.
The bridegroom's mother is a family psychotherapist in Arlington, Va. His father was an accountant for the Navy in Washington.
